experience: You and Christie both know Kyle Burnett, Eric Keosky-Smith, and 181 others
I have hired more poeple in my career than I could possibly remember. One of the first things I look at is their LinkedIn profile. I make my initial decision based on what I see there.
If anyone would like me to take a look at your profile and give my opinion just comment below and include  your idea role. I'm happy to spend a few minutes and give some feedback.
I can't promise it will be life changing but it will be honest. #hireme #jobhunt

Thought provoking discussion led by Clint! Runge with the #ASU Marketing HUB team, answer to the question what’s the biggest bang for our marketing dollars in this new world: leverage relationships and listen to the youngest people on your staff. Plus a great quote by revamped #levi’s below:
I'm honored to join these brilliant folks as a coach during Phoenix Startup Weekend 11/17-19 at Galvanize. My focus will be on marketing, obvi. Hit me up for a discount code.
Since I joined GetAccept my inbox has gone crazy with people trying to prospect into me and you know what....I love it!
When reps try to sell to me I receive the following benefits:
- I see which messages don't resonate; so my team and I can avoid making the same mistakes
- I understand ways to improve the sales and marketing process of companies which sell to me, which allows me to pass signals on to my team to help in selling to them down the road
- If reps are outstanding with their approach, I can motion to hire them or forward their outreach onto people I am training
- I continually appreciate and value the importance of getting to the point in what is becoming a more crowded inbox
Finally rather than abusing people who send me a note or shaming them on LinkedIn I try to send them a point or two about what would work next time.
We need to empathize with people trying to forge a career in sales, after all many of us were at the beginning at some point.
Furthermore if we are going to retain talent we need to ensure they are encouraged and motivated to learn, grow and stay in the profession

Startup Grind is a global startup community, powered by Google for Entrepreneurs, designed to educate, inspire and connect ambitious entrepreneurs.As National Director I deepen and grow our presence across the Americas.
I work with top AZ startups to help them grow their business through the Founders Collective series of retreats and forums.
Professional Emcee, Host, Interviewer, Speaker, Moderator + Facilitator

Ensuring the programming is smooth and the audience stays engaged is my forte.  I host and emcee (aka Master of Ceremonies - MC) events large and small.  I also act as an expert panel moderator, interviewer and programming facilitator for corporate and business events.  My superpower is making what could otherwise be dry topics (no more boring panels!) interesting and practically fun.  In addition to being a professional speaker I teach others how to overcome their fear of public speaking so they can confidently share their messages at www.publicspeaking.school.

Simply put, I teach business skills to business owners; delivering real-world biz education to startup entrepreneurs and established business owners.  I have a special knack for ensuring strategy and tactics come together for powerful {implemented} impact... and making sure we have fun along the way.Launch MiE = Marketing, Efficiency & Technology Consulting | We help you create more success.

As the Executive Director of ASU Student Entrepreneurship, on ASU's Office of Knowledge Enterprise Development: Entrepreneurship + Innovation team, I align and coordinate university-wide student entrepreneurship programs and activities; collaborating and advocating on behalf of students within all schools, centers and institutes at ASU.
As a part of the StartupAZ Foundation Founders Collective Committee I focus on helping our area's top startups accelerate their path to success through venture development access and programs.
As a part of the StartupAZ Foundation Founders Collective Committee I focus on helping our area's top startups accelerate their path to success through venture development access and programs.

Venture Madness is Invest Southwest’s signature annual event which takes place in early March. This one-of-a-kind competition event pits 64 of the Southwest's most promising startup companies against one another in a single-elimination, bracket-style tournament.

Christie Kerner is one of the key catalysts in the Phoenix startup community who has influenced a culture of warmth, generosity, and collaboration. She goes out of her way to serve others by building bridges, sharing her wisdom, and fostering community. She hardly needs a recommendation, yet she deserves more visibility for her contributions. If you get an opportunity to work with her, I strongly encourage you to do so!

Starter | Community builder | People lover | #yesphx | @IntraEdge
September 8, 2014, Jonathan worked with Christie but at different companies

Christie is everywhere in Phoenix, and that's a very good thing for us all! Everywhere she goes, she brings a neighborly spirit to help entrepreneurs and the local startup scene, educating and connecting all she comes to meet and know, whether that's over impromptu coffee run-ins, StartupGrind's monthly events, or at the local coworking spots in town. There isn't anything Christie wouldn't do to help you and your business succeed. Even more importantly than all this, she's an extremely kind and pleasant person to be around--something we all need more of these days.

I have had the opportunity to work with Christie multiple times as a speaker at events I've organized for entrepreneurs and those considering starting their own business.  Christie is a wonderful speaker -- she can take content that in other hands might be boring (i.e. operational, licensing and legal requirements for opening a business) and make it educational and fun.  She is incredibly organized, clear and approachable. I can recommend her without reservation as a speaker and educator.  My attendees just love her.

summary: It was over 20 years ago that Christie Simmons first helped launch a company, and that company became a multi-million dollar business within two years.  Since then she has helped hundreds of entrepreneurs create more success.In addition to her own entrepreneurial endeavors and her consulting practice, she has worked in Fortune 100 companies where she consistently won awards for identifying, creating and implementing efficient processes that leveraged technology to lower expenses and drive revenue.  Her deep understanding of both human behavior and business make her an uncanny expert at marketing; and her ability to translate strategy into tactics ensures things get done.Christie is a very active connector in the #yesphx Phoenix business community.  She was formerly the Director of the Center for Entrepreneurship in the W. P. Carey School of Business and the Executive Director of Student Entrepreneurship at Arizona State University.  She is now a National Director for Startup Grind and is also the Chair of Venture Development for StartupAZ Foundation's Founders Collective series.
name: Christie (Kerner) Simmons
title: National Director, Americas: Startup Grind | Connector
